Question: Sharks are mammals.
comment: they are actually classified as fish.

Question: Sea otters have a favorite rock they use to break open food.
comment: True - they keep these treasures in the loose skin under their arms.

Question3: The blue whale is the biggest animal to have ever lived.

Question4: The hummingbird egg is the world's smallest bird egg.
comment4: True - on the flip side, ostriches lay the largest eggs.

Question5: Pigs roll in the mud because they don't like being clean.
comment5: False - pigs have few sweat glands and their muddy baths help keep them cool.

comment6: False - their eyes work, just not particularly well.

Question7: A dog sweats by panting its tongue.
comment7: False - canines sweat through glands in their paws.

Question8: It takes a sloth two weeks to digest a meal.
comment8: True - that's the slowest digestion time of any mammal.

Question9: The largest living frog is the Goliath frog of West Africa.
comment9: True - this amphibian reaches lengths of 12.5 inches and weighs 7.2 pounds.

Question10: An ant can lift 1,000 times its body weight.
comment10: False - ants can lift 5,000 times their body weight.
